RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Andrea Vestrucci (Milo, Itlia, 1981), possui mestrado em Filosofia - Universidade de Milo (2005), doutorado em Filosofia Poltica e Moral na Universidade Charles de Gaulle Lille III (2009) e doutorado em tica da Universidade de Milo (2009). pesquisador dos Centros Francs de Pesquisa "Savoir Texte Language" et "Ceac" (Universit LilleIII). Foi Professor Visitante na UFC pelo programa Erasmus Mundus (2010). Os campos de sua pesquisa so os seguintes: tica e Filosofia Poltica (Aristteles, Kant, Hegel); As filosofias de Eric Weil e Agnes Heller; A conexo entre as dimenses tica e esttica a partir do Classicismo alemo (Kant, Schiller, Goethe at Kierkegaard, Lukcs, Thomas Mann); a logica da sociedade moderna, o sistema dos carecimentos e o problema da insatisfao (especialmente em Hegel, Lukcs, Eric Weil, Agnes Heller); a pesquisa e o aprofondimento sobre as mulheres filsofas (Hannah Arendt, Martha Nussbaum, Mara Zambrano, Agnes Heller); a interpretao tica da Literatura, Msica e Belas Artes (Sfocles, Feodor Dostoevskij, Thomas Mann, JS Bach, WA Mozart, R. Wagner, F. Bacon); Musicologia.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Vestrucci Andrea (Milan, Italy, 1981), holds a Masters in Philosophy - University of Milan (2005), a Ph.D. in Moral and Political Philosophy at the University Charles de Gaulle Lille III (2009) and a Ph.D. in Ethics, University of Milan (2009). He is a researcher of the French Research Centres "Savoir Texte Language" et "CEAC" (Universit LilleIII). He is currently a Visiting Professor at the UFC with program Erasmus Mundus. The fields of his research are: Ethics and Political Philosophy (Aristotle, Kant, Hegel); Philosophies of Eric Weil and Agnes Heller; The connection between the aesthetic and ethical dimensions from German Classicism (Kant, Schiller, Goethe up Kierkegaard, Nietzsche, Lukacs, Thomas Mann); The theories of needs and alienation (especially in Hegel, Marx, Lukacs, Eric Weil, Agnes Heller) and its application in modern social conditions; Women studies - women philosophers (Arendt, Martha Nussbaum, Mara Zambrano, Agnes Heller); the ethical interpretation of Literature, Music and Fine Arts (Sophocles, Feodor Dostoevskij, Thomas Mann, JS Bach, WA Mozart, R. Wagner, F. Bacon); Musicology.

OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES:
MEMBERSHIPS
Since Winter 2010: Member of the Directorate of the Italian Filosofical Society - Societ Filosofica Italiana (SFI) - Lombardy Section (Italy)
Since Summer 2009: Member of Center of Studies in Contemporary Arts - Centres dtudes en Arts Contemporains (CEAC), Universit Charles-de-Gaulle Lille3 (France)
Since Spring 2007: Member of the Research Center Savoirs, Textes, Languages (STL), Universit Charles-de-Gaulle Lille3 (France)
FIELDS OF RESEARCH
Philosophy of Morals with specific reference to Aristotle, Kant, Hegel
Philosophies of Eric Weil and gnes Heller
Formal ethics: the categorical imperative as representation of the moral law. Analysis and Duplik of criticisms to Kantian ethics (Hegel, Habermas). The moral aesthetics (Schiller).
Relationship between ethics and aesthetics from German classicism to contemporary philosophy (Lukacs). The problem of the ethics of personality. The connection between ethic action and aesthetic action.
The logic of modern society, the system of needs and the problem of dissatisfaction (Hegel, Lukacs, Heller and Weil)
Women philosopher: the thought of Hannah Arendt, Maria Zambrano, Agnes Heller, Martha Nussbaum.
The ethical analysis literature (Sophocles, Thomas Mann) and music (J. S. Bach, W. A. Mozart)
The religious world in Dostoevskij
Musicology

Italian Teacher and Senior Counselor at the Concordia University Italian Summer School Program, in Moorhead, MN, USA. - Courses on Italian Language and Culture (ages 7-18) o Lessons on grammar rules, sentence construction, connectors, and deepening of Italian vocabulary; role-play game lessons and strong interactive approach. o Lessons on Italian culture (fine arts, literature, music) and enrichment of vocabulary with specific terminology. - Lessons on Italian baroque music and Italian Commedia dell Arte . - Organization of special practical days of studies on Italian culture. - Students examination: organization and ideation of tests and exercises; evaluation and description of students attitudes and results. - Coordination of activities and games, responsibility for students safety.

Tutor of Graduate Students, Dept. of Philosophy, University of Milan, Italy. - Individual tutoring activities and consulting hours service. - Special individual and collective activities for Foreigner Students at the University of Milan

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Area 13 - scienze storiche, filosofiche, pedagogiche e psicologiche

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Natura, Realt umana e filosofie dal XV al XX secolo
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: La ricerca si propone di indagare in un arco di tempo plurisecolare lo sviluppo di alcune delle principali categorie del pensiero scientifico, politico e religioso, ponendoli in stretta connessione con le dottrine e i sistemi filosofici. In questa direzione si esamineranno i fenomeni di cultura rinascimentale, con particolare attenzione ai saperi magici e medici, per trascorrere all'individuazione dei grandi sistemi filosofici dei secc. XVII e XVIII in relazione ai problemi della nascita della scienza moderna. Una sezione ulteriore riguarder le nuove figure della ragione a partire dalla rivoluzione romantica fino alla crisi della metafisica occidentale: da Kant a Heidegger.

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Area 13 - scienze storiche, filosofiche, pedagogiche e psicologiche

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The research project intends to deepen the connection between the dimensions of the ethics and the aesthetics within the framework of the aesthetic nature of the ethical action. The research can be inserted in the context of the moral aesthetics, conceiving the ethical character as product of self-education, the ethical action as product and producer of beauty, and referring to the connection between the ethical and aesthetic forms of its production, the modality of its reception, and the extent of the following judgment.The subjects involved in the present research are both theoretical and historical. The theoretical ones refer to the themes and main topics the research intends to treat. The historical ones refers to philosophers and moments in the history of philosophy concerned or interpreted as main expression and authoritative exempla of the main subject of research (immanuel Kant, Friederich Schiller, Soren Kierkegaard, Friederich Nietzsche, Thomas Mann, Gyorgy Lukacs, Eric Weil, Agnes Heller...)

Member of the Scientific Commettee for the French journal Filigrane - for the issue "Deleuze and Music".
ISSN: 1773-9128

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The research project refers to the form of freedom involved in the aesthetic interpretation of the ethical action. The research intends to analyse three different forms of freedom as its possible conceptualizations: the physical freedom (freedom of movement), the rational freedom (consisting in the self-attribution of an autonomous law) and the freedom of personality , or freedom as liberation (the movement of becoming what one is). The analysis consists in the evaluation of the pertinence of each kind of freedom to the topic of the moral aesthetics. In specific, the purpose of this part of the research consists in the discussion of the relevance of the third kind of freedom within the form of the spontaneous and idiosyncratic self-universalisation. The individual conceives the possibility of universalisation as source of meaning of his/her own idiosyncrasy: in fact the idiosyncrasy, if deprived of this connection to a formal ground, would rest in a condition of arbitrary and violence. Therefore the connection with the universalisation allows the idiosyncrasy to be understood and recognized by the other human beings. Consequently, the more the individual is involved in the process of universalisation the more the own idiosyncrasy receives value and vice versa the more the aesthetics and uniqueness of the ethical character is expressed in the actions, the more the individual proceeds in the self-assignment of a necessary and universal role.
